<Text: The Black Star Line (1919−1922) was a shipping line incorporated by Marcus Garvey, the organizer of the Universal Negro Improvement Association (UNIA), and other members of the UNIA.>

Text: Black Star Line:  It derived its name from the White Star Line, a line whose success Garvey felt he could duplicate.

Text: Black Star Line:  Black Star Line became a key part of Garvey's contribution to the Back-to-Africa movement.
